ygData.subject: Re: Help on factions?
ygData.msgSnippet: Being a Human Necromancer, I don t quite have the added impact of being a Dark Elf.  However, I can say that you ll never fully counter the KoS (Kill on Sight)
ygData.messageBody:
Being a Human Necromancer, I don't quite have the added impact of being
a Dark Elf. However, I can say that you'll never fully counter the KoS
(Kill on Sight) that Necromancers have to deal with. The best you can do is
improve your faction so most of the guards don't kill you on sight and you
can shop with most merchants.

An example. I /con`ed an NPC merchant in an Inn. I got "..kindly
considers you..". I got close enough to open the merchant window, and she
promptly made a stain of me.

I'd guess you Dark Elves have it even worse, I don't know if you can fix
your faction so the guards wont kill you, but since Trolls can, I'd imagin
you can too. Other DE Necros should be able to tell ya. :-)

~Myskyra / Tunare

----- Original Message -----
From: Murphy, Kenneth E. <MurphyK@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 4:49 PM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Help on factions?


> From: "Murphy, Kenneth E." <MurphyK@...>
>
> Hello.
>
> I am eloric Necromancer of the 2nd Rank. When I obtain the 3rd Rank I am
> planning to venture out from my homeland. However, Being a worshipper of
> Innoruke (sp) and being a dark elf and a necromancer give me large
negative
> standing with most peoples of the world.
>
> Can anyone tell me if this is possible to overcome and to what degree? IE.
> Can I complete overcome this by killing things and getting the faction
> adjustments or is there a cap. For example will I always be hated by the
> north freeport paladins even if I kill 100s of corrupt guards?
>
> Has any fellow dark elf necromancers had any success with raising their
> faction to an acceptable level outside of home? If so which groups?
>
> Thanks for the help.
>
> Eloric
>
>
>
> ... Thanks Kenneth
